title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 13 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 13.

questions.question: In which year of King Jeroboam's reign did Abijah begin to reign over Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: Eighteenth year
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:1 states that Abijah began to reign in the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam.

questions.question: How many years did Abijah reign in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Three years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:2 mentions that Abijah reigned three years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who was Abijah's mother?
questions.correctAnswer: Michaiah the daughter of Uriel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:2 identifies Abijah's mother as Michaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah.

questions.question: How many chosen men did Abijah have in his army?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:3 says Abijah had 400,000 chosen men of war.

questions.question: How many chosen men did Jeroboam have in his army?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:3 states Jeroboam set the battle with 800,000 chosen men.

questions.question: From which mountain did Abijah address Jeroboam and all Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Mount Zemaraim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:4 states Abijah stood upon mount Zemaraim in mount Ephraim to speak.

questions.question: According to Abijah, to whom did the LORD God of Israel give the kingdom forever by a covenant of salt?
questions.correctAnswer: David and his sons
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:5 says the kingdom was given to David and his sons by covenant of salt.

questions.question: True or False: Jeroboam rebelled against Solomon, son of David.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:6 states Jeroboam, son of Nebat, servant of Solomon, rose up and rebelled against his lord.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 13, what did Jeroboam make for the people to worship instead of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Golden calves
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:8 describes Jeroboam making golden calves for the people to worship.

questions.question: What type of priests did Jeroboam make, according to Abijah's speech?
options: Priests after the manner of the nations
questions.correctAnswer: Priests after the manner of the nations
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:9 explains Jeroboam made priests like those of other nations, not sons of Aaron or Levites.

questions.question: True or False: The priests who ministered to the LORD in Judah were sons of Aaron and Levites.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:10 confirms that the priests ministering to the LORD were sons of Aaron and the Levites attended their duties.

questions.question: What did the priests burn every morning and evening in Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt sacrifices and sweet incense
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:11 states they burned burnt sacrifices and sweet incense every morning and evening.

questions.question: What was God described as in Judah's battle against Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Their captain
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:12 says God was with them as their captain in battle.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel defeated Judah in the battle described in this chapter.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:15-17 details how God smote Jeroboam and Israel before Abijah and Judah, leading to Israel's defeat.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Bethel with the towns thereof, and ______ with the towns thereof, and Ephrain with the towns thereof.'
questions.correctAnswer: Jeshanah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:19 records Abijah taking Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephrain with their towns from Jeroboam.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 13 teach us about trusting God in difficult battles?
options: God himself is with us as our captain, so we should rely on Him for victory
We should depend on our own strength and numbers for success
Winning battles depends mainly on clever ambushes and strategy
Victory comes from making idols to protect us
questions.correctAnswer: God himself is with us as our captain, so we should rely on Him for victory
questions.explanation: Verse 12 teaches that God is with His people as their captain, and trusting Him leads to success, supported by verses 14-16 where God delivers Judah in battle.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God in a conflict. Based on 2 Chronicles 13, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Rely on God and call on Him in prayer, as Judah did in battle
Use your own wisdom and avoid prayer
Make physical preparations only, ignoring spiritual reliance
Follow popular opinion instead of God's commands
questions.correctAnswer: Rely on God and call on Him in prayer, as Judah did in battle
questions.explanation: Verses 14 and 15 show Judah crying unto the LORD and priests sounding trumpets before God delivered them, emphasizing prayer and dependence on God in struggles.

questions.question: What does this chapter teach us about obedience to God's appointed leaders and worship practices?
options: Obey God's appointed priests and avoid false worship
Create your own priests and idols as you please
Worship is flexible and can be adapted to popular culture
questions.correctAnswer: Obey God's appointed priests and avoid false worship
questions.explanation: Verses 9-11 emphasize the importance of following God's ordained priests and proper worship, contrasting this with Jeroboam's idolatry and false priests.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to follow practices that are not God-honoring. What guidance does 2 Chronicles 13 give?
options: Remain faithful to the LORD and His ordained ways
Follow the customs of other nations without question
Ignore the role of priests and worship rituals
Make idols to ensure God's favor
questions.correctAnswer: Remain faithful to the LORD and His ordained ways
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 highlight Judah's faithfulness to God and proper worship, encouraging believers to honor God's commands rather than adopting false customs.

questions.question: How does this passage encourage humility and contentment in leadership?
options: Rely on God's covenant and recognition rather than boasting in numbers
Boast about your army size and strength
Disregard God's promises and trust in human power
Seek glory through rebellion and idol worship
questions.correctAnswer: Rely on God's covenant and recognition rather than boasting in numbers
questions.explanation: Abijah reminds Jeroboam of God's covenant with David (verse 5) to show that true authority comes from God, not from mere human power or numbers (verses 3-4).

questions.question: What practical lesson about family life can be learned from Abijah's story in this chapter?
options: A godly leader may have a large family and still maintain faithfulness to God
Large families are always a sign of God's disfavor
Marriage and children are unimportant in spiritual leadership
questions.correctAnswer: A godly leader may have a large family and still maintain faithfulness to God
questions.explanation: Verse 21 notes Abijah married fourteen wives and had many children, yet the chapter emphasizes his reliance on God (verses 18, 22), illustrating that family life can coexist with faithfulness.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 13, Jeroboam's idolatry led to his defeat and death.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 8, 20 show Jeroboam's idolatry with golden calves and that the LORD struck him, resulting in his death, linking disobedience with consequences.

questions.question: True or False: The priests of Judah were sons of Aaron, and they faithfully performed their duties during Abijah's reign.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 affirm that Judah kept the charge of the LORD with priests who were sons of Aaron faithfully ministering and offering sacrifices.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 13 illustrate perseverance through trials and trust in God's deliverance?
options: Judah cried to the LORD in the face of ambush and was delivered
They gave up when surrounded and relied on their own weapons
They sought peace by compromising worship
They trusted in their numbers alone without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Judah cried to the LORD in the face of ambush and was delivered
questions.explanation: Verses 13-16 describe Judah being ambushed but crying to God and the priests sounding trumpets, resulting in God's deliverance, teaching perseverance and trust.

questions.question: A believer faces opposition in their service to God. Based on this chapter, what principle about leadership and faithfulness can be shared?
options: Faithfulness to God leads to prevailing over opposition
Opposition means God has abandoned you
Success is guaranteed by avoiding confrontation
Leaders should compromise to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness to God leads to prevailing over opposition
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states Judah prevailed because they relied on the LORD God of their fathers, showing faithfulness results in victory despite opposition.

questions.question: What does this passage teach about the importance of maintaining proper worship and not following the ways of other nations?
options: True worship involves following God's commands and ordained priests, not imitating other nations
Adopting foreign worship practices is acceptable
Worship methods are unimportant as long as one prays
Idols can be part of sincere worship
questions.correctAnswer: True worship involves following God's commands and ordained priests, not imitating other nations
questions.explanation: Verse 9 criticizes Israel for casting out the sons of Aaron and making priests like other nations, contrasting with Judah's faithful worship in verses 10-11.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Abijah set the battle in array with an army of ______ chosen men of war.
questions.correctAnswer: four hundred thousand
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states that Abijah had four hundred thousand chosen men of war, showing his reliance on God despite being outnumbered.

questions.question: How does this chapter guide us in understanding the role of prayer and worship in spiritual warfare?
options: Prayer and worship are vital weapons in spiritual battles
Only physical weapons determine the battle outcome
Worship is secondary to military strategy
Victory depends on idols and sacrifices alone
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and worship are vital weapons in spiritual battles
questions.explanation: Verses 12-15 describe the priests sounding trumpets and the people crying to the LORD, demonstrating prayer and worship as key to victory.

questions.question: What lesson about integrity and honesty in leadership is seen in Abijah's address to Jeroboam?
options: Abijah honestly confronts Jeroboam about rebellion and idolatry
Abijah deceives Jeroboam to gain advantage
Leaders should avoid difficult truths to keep peace
Integrity is not important in leadership
questions.correctAnswer: Abijah honestly confronts Jeroboam about rebellion and idolatry
questions.explanation: Verses 6-9 show Abijah openly rebuking Jeroboam's rebellion and idolatry, illustrating the importance of integrity and speaking truth in leadership.

questions.question: How does Abijah's reliance on God's covenant in this chapter encourage believers to persevere through trials?
options: Believers can find confidence by remembering God's promises and covenant faithfulness
Trials mean God has forgotten His people
Success depends on human effort alone
Covenants are irrelevant to present struggles
questions.correctAnswer: Believers can find confidence by remembering God's promises and covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Verse 5 highlights the covenant God made with David, reminding believers that God's promises endure and provide strength in trials.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 13.

questions.question: Who began to reign over Judah in the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam's reign?
questions.correctAnswer: Abijah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:1 explicitly states that Abijah began to reign over Judah in the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam's reign.

questions.question: What was the size of Abijah's army as he set the battle in array against Jeroboam?
questions.correctAnswer: 400,000 chosen men
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 13:3, Abijah commanded an army of 400,000 chosen men of valor.

questions.question: From which location did Abijah address Jeroboam and all Israel before the battle?
questions.correctAnswer: Mount Zemaraim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:4 records Abijah standing upon Mount Zemaraim in Mount Ephraim when he addressed Jeroboam and all Israel.

questions.question: What covenant did Abijah remind Jeroboam that God made with David?
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant of salt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:5 mentions that God gave the kingdom over Israel to David and his sons by a covenant of salt, signifying permanence and faithfulness.

questions.question: Which phrase best describes the priests Jeroboam appointed, according to Abijah?
options: Priests after the manner of other nations
questions.correctAnswer: Priests after the manner of other nations
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:9 states that Jeroboam cast out the LORD's priests and made priests after the manner of the nations, which was seen as illegitimate.

questions.question: What was the theological reason Abijah gave for Judah’s victory over Israel?
options: They relied upon the LORD God of their fathers
questions.correctAnswer: They relied upon the LORD God of their fathers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:18 explains that Judah prevailed because they relied upon the LORD God of their fathers, highlighting divine favor over military might.

questions.question: What role did the priests serve during the battle according to Abijah’s speech?
options: They blew trumpets to cry alarm
They led the charge into battle
They offered sacrifices on the battlefield
questions.correctAnswer: They blew trumpets to cry alarm
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:12 states that God’s priests were with sounding trumpets to cry alarm against Jeroboam’s forces, symbolizing divine intervention.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Jeroboam’s military strategy during the battle?
options: He caused an ambush to come behind Judah
He attacked from the front only
questions.correctAnswer: He caused an ambush to come behind Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:13 records that Jeroboam arranged an ambush behind Judah’s forces, attempting to surround them.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Abijah married _____ wives and begat _____ sons and _____ daughters.
questions.correctAnswer: fourteen; twenty-two; sixteen
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:21 states specifically that Abijah married fourteen wives and fathered twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.

questions.question: True or False: Jeroboam recovered his strength and ruled strongly after Abijah’s reign.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:20 clearly notes that Jeroboam did not recover strength in the days of Abijah and that the LORD struck him and he died.

questions.question: What did Abijah accuse Jeroboam and Israel of doing that showed their unfaithfulness to God?
questions.correctAnswer: Making golden calves for gods
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:8 highlights Abijah’s accusation that Jeroboam made golden calves for gods, which Israel worshipped instead of the LORD.

questions.question: What was the result of the battle between Judah and Israel as described in this chapter?
options: Judah defeated Israel with great slaughter
questions.correctAnswer: Judah defeated Israel with great slaughter
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:17 describes a great slaughter where Judah killed 500,000 chosen men of Israel, indicating a decisive Judahite victory.

questions.question: Which cities did Abijah take from Jeroboam after the battle?
questions.correctAnswer: Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephrain
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:19 records that Abijah pursued Jeroboam and took Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephrain with their towns.

questions.question: How does Abijah’s speech use typology to contrast the legitimacy of his reign versus Jeroboam’s?
options: By emphasizing the covenant with David and legitimate priesthood
By focusing on military power and numbers
By citing the wealth of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: By emphasizing the covenant with David and legitimate priesthood
questions.explanation: Abijah highlights God’s covenant with David and the legitimate Aaronic priesthood (2 Chronicles 13:5, 9-10) as typological evidence contrasting Jeroboam’s rebellion and false priests.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Abijah’s speech when he calls Jeroboam and his followers 'children of Belial'?
options: Pejorative epithet to emphasize moral corruption
questions.correctAnswer: Pejorative epithet to emphasize moral corruption
questions.explanation: The term 'children of Belial' in 2 Chronicles 13:7 is a Hebrew pejorative used to denote worthlessness and wickedness, emphasizing the moral and religious corruption of Jeroboam’s followers.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 13 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 13, what covenant did the LORD God establish with David concerning his kingdom?
options: A covenant of salt that the kingdom would be given to David and his descendants forever
A covenant of peace that David’s kingdom would be without war
A covenant of prosperity that David’s kingdom would never face famine
A covenant of silence that David’s kingdom would not be spoken against
questions.correctAnswer: A covenant of salt that the kingdom would be given to David and his descendants forever
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:5 states that the LORD God gave the kingdom to David for ever by a covenant of salt. This signifies an enduring, perpetual covenant (cf. Numbers 18:19; Leviticus 2:13; Matthew 26:28; Hebrews 13:20).

questions.question: What reason does Abijah give for the legitimacy of his reign over Jeroboam’s rule?
options: The LORD God appointed David’s descendants to rule by covenant
Jeroboam was not of the tribe of Judah
Jeroboam did not have an army as strong as Abijah’s
Abijah’s mother was from a royal family
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD God appointed David’s descendants to rule by covenant
questions.explanation: Abijah appeals to the divine covenant with David as the basis for his legitimate rule, emphasizing God’s sovereign appointment (2 Chronicles 13:5). This aligns with biblical teaching about God’s covenant promises to David’s line (2 Samuel 7:12-16; Psalm 89:3-4; Isaiah 55:3).

questions.question: What critique does Abijah make about Jeroboam’s religious practices?
options: Jeroboam made golden calves and appointed priests who were not Levites
Jeroboam worshiped the moon and ignored the LORD
Jeroboam destroyed the temple and its vessels
Jeroboam forbade sacrifices and burnt offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Jeroboam made golden calves and appointed priests who were not Levites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:8-9 explains that Jeroboam made golden calves for worship and appointed priests according to the customs of other nations, not from the sons of Aaron or the Levites, violating God’s ordained priesthood (cf. Exodus 32:1-6; Deuteronomy 18:1-5; Malachi 2:7).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Abijah declared that the priests who ministered to the LORD were the sons of ______ and the Levites.
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:10 identifies that the legitimate priests were the sons of Aaron, emphasizing the importance of the divinely appointed priestly lineage in worship (Exodus 28:1; Hebrews 7:23-28; Leviticus 8).

questions.question: What role did God play in the battle according to Abijah’s speech?
options: God was their captain and the priests with trumpets cried alarm against Israel
God remained silent and allowed the battle to be decided by men
God sent an earthquake to stop the fighting
God gave Jeroboam’s army a false sense of security
questions.correctAnswer: God was their captain and the priests with trumpets cried alarm against Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:12 declares God himself as their captain, with priests blowing trumpets to signal alarm, showing God’s direct involvement in the battle (cf. Joshua 6:20; 1 Samuel 17:45-47; Psalm 46:7).

questions.question: How did God respond to the prayer and shout of the men of Judah during the battle?
options: God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah
God sent rain to stop the battle
God caused the sun to set early
questions.correctAnswer: God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:15 states that when the men of Judah shouted and cried unto the LORD, God struck Jeroboam and Israel causing their defeat, demonstrating God’s sovereign power and faithfulness (cf. Exodus 14:27-28; Judges 7:22; 2 Samuel 5:20).

questions.question: What theological principle is illustrated by the victory of Judah over Israel in this chapter?
options: Trust in the LORD leads to victory
Wealth and gold idols bring blessings
Human strength alone secures the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in the LORD leads to victory
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:18 highlights that Judah prevailed because they relied upon the LORD God of their fathers, illustrating the biblical principle that faith and dependence on God bring success (cf. Psalm 20:7-8; Proverbs 3:5-6; James 4:7).

questions.question: What consequence did Jeroboam face after his defeat by Abijah?
options: He was struck by the LORD and died
He was taken captive and imprisoned
He repented and restored the priests
He fled to Egypt and lived in exile
questions.correctAnswer: He was struck by the LORD and died
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:20 records that Jeroboam never recovered strength during Abijah’s reign and that the LORD struck him and he died, demonstrating divine judgment (cf. 1 Kings 14:7-16; Ezekiel 21:25-27).

questions.question: How many wives and children did Abijah have according to this chapter?
options: Fourteen wives, twenty-two sons, and sixteen daughters
Ten wives, fifteen sons, and twelve daughters
Seven wives, fourteen sons, and ten daughters
One wife, three sons, and two daughters
questions.correctAnswer: Fourteen wives, twenty-two sons, and sixteen daughters
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:21 states that Abijah had fourteen wives and fathered twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters, reflecting the royal polygamous practices of the time (cf. 1 Kings 11:3; Genesis 25:1-6).

questions.question: Which cities did Abijah capture from Jeroboam during his pursuit?
options: Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephrain with their towns
questions.correctAnswer: Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephrain with their towns
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:19 records that Abijah took Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephrain with their towns from Jeroboam, showing the territorial expansion under divine favor (cf. Joshua 18:13; 1 Kings 12:29).

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 13 reveal about the nature of legitimate worship of God?
options: It must be conducted by priests from the sons of Aaron and the Levites
It can be performed by anyone who chooses to worship
It involves worshiping golden calves as God’s image
It does not require sacrifices or incense
questions.correctAnswer: It must be conducted by priests from the sons of Aaron and the Levites
questions.explanation: Verses 9-11 emphasize that true worship involves the ordained priesthood of Aaron’s descendants and the Levites, with sacrifices and incense, contrasting with Jeroboam’s unauthorized priests (cf. Exodus 28:1; Leviticus 10:8-11; Hebrews 7:11-17).

questions.question: What was the spiritual state of those who joined Jeroboam according to Abijah?
options: They were called vain men, children of Belial
They were faithful worshipers of the LORD
They were prophets sent by God
They were humble servants of David
questions.correctAnswer: They were called vain men, children of Belial
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:7 describes Jeroboam’s followers as vain men and children of Belial, indicating their wickedness and rebellion against God’s covenant (cf. Deuteronomy 13:13; Judges 19:22; 2 Corinthians 6:15).

questions.question: What does the chapter reveal about God’s faithfulness to His covenant promises?
options: God upheld the covenant with David by granting victory to his descendants
God abandoned David’s line due to their sins
God changed the covenant to favor Jeroboam
God remained neutral in the conflict
questions.correctAnswer: God upheld the covenant with David by granting victory to his descendants
questions.explanation: The narrative shows God’s faithfulness in giving victory to Abijah, a descendant of David, in line with His covenant (2 Chronicles 13:5, 18). Biblical theology affirms God’s unchanging covenantal faithfulness (Psalm 89:34; Isaiah 55:3; Romans 11:29).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the role of priests during the battle as described in the chapter?
options: They sounded trumpets to signal God’s presence and alarm
They fought alongside the soldiers with swords
They remained in the temple offering sacrifices only
They negotiated peace between the armies
questions.correctAnswer: They sounded trumpets to signal God’s presence and alarm
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:12 and 14 describe priests sounding trumpets to cry alarm and signal God’s presence in battle, highlighting the priestly role in spiritual warfare (cf. Numbers 10:1-10; Joshua 6:20; 1 Samuel 13:3).

questions.question: What does Abijah accuse Jeroboam’s faction of doing that undermines true worship?
options: Casting out the priests of the LORD and making non-Levitical priests
Building new altars at the temple
Observing the Sabbath with extra zeal
questions.correctAnswer: Casting out the priests of the LORD and making non-Levitical priests
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 13:9 states that Jeroboam’s faction cast out the true priests and Levites and made priests in the manner of other nations, thus corrupting worship (cf. 1 Kings 12:31-33; Malachi 2:7; Ezekiel 22:26).
